subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Socratic Method: Destroying Arguments with Questions
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Socratic Method: Destroying Arguments with Questions.

hook.text: Socrates never told anyone they were wrong. He just asked questions until they realized it themselves.

buildup.text: The Socratic method: a series of targeted questions that expose assumptions, contradictions, and gaps in reasoning.

discovery.text: The pattern: 'What do you mean by X?' 'How do you know that?' 'What if the opposite were true?' 'Can you give an example?'

twist.text: Socrates was executed for it. Powerful people hate being shown they don't know what they're talking about.

climax.text: Modern use: law school, medical training, and therapy all use Socratic questioning to develop deeper reasoning.

punchline.text: The right question is more powerful than the right answer.

quiz.question: What is the Socratic method?
options: A series of questions that expose assumptions and contradictions in reasoning
